description.en:
3-D structure of proteins; X-ray; Neutron diffraction. Structure of proteins in solution from NMR methods. The structural building blocks. Motifs or supersecondary structures. Assembly of proteins from the building blocks.
Protein diversity. Introns, exons, and inteins and exteins. Divergent evolution of families of proteins. Convergent evolution. Evolution of proteins by fusion of gene fragments. Homology, sequence identity, and structural similarity.
Principles of chemical catalysis. Transition state theory. The Hammond postulate. Chemical basis of the Hammond postulate. Intramolecular catalysis: The "effective concentration" of a group on an enzyme. General acid-base catalysis. Entropy: The theoretical basis of intramolecular catalysis and effective concentration. Electrostatic catalysis. Metal ion catalysis. Covalent catalysis. Electrophilic catalysis by Schiff base formation. Pyridoxal phosphate-Electrophilic catalysis. Thiamine pyrophosphate-Electrophilic catalysis. Nucleophilic catalysis. Structure-activity relationships. Nucleophilic attack at the carbonyl group. The principle of microscopic reversibility or detailed balance. The principle of kinetic equivalence.
description.et: Valkude 3-D struktuur; röntgenstruktuuranalüüs; Valkude struktuuri määramine lahustes NMR-i meetoditega. Valkude struktuuri elemendid. Supersekundaarse struktuuri motiivid. Valkude assambleerumine struktuurielementidest. Valkude tüübid. Intronid, eksonid, inteiinid ja eksteiinid. Valguperekondade divergeeruv ja konvergeeruv evolutsioon. Valkude evolutsioon geenifragmentide liitumise läbi. Homoloogia ja struktuuriline sarnasus. Keemilise katalüüsi põhiprintsiibid. Vaheoleku-aktiveeritud oleku teooria. Hammondi postulaat. Intramolekulaarne katalüüs: "efektiivse kontsentratsiooni" mõiste. Elektrostaatiline katalüüs. Metalli-ioonide katalüüs. Kovalentne katalüüs. Elektrofiilne katalüüs ja Schiffi aluse moodustumine. Püridoksaalfosfaat - elektrofiilne katalüüs. Thiamine pürofosfaat - elektrofiilne katalüüs. Nukleofiilne katalüüs. Struktuur-aktiivsussõltuvused. Mikroskoopse tasakaalu printsiibid. Kineetilise ekvivalentsi printsiip.

objectives.en: The aims of the course are revealed in synergy of its 4 modules. The students of the Bioengineering and Robotics direction of the Science & Technology undergraduate program will obtain a general overview of the biological signal transduction mechanisms and skills to use the knowledge of logic and components of these mechanism in synthetic biology in general.  in the design of biological systems with novel functions, but also in drug development and biomedical research. The course offers the insight of the cell signaling and mechanism on three main levels: 1) signal transduction pathways, 2) structure of signaling proteins, 2) kinetic and mechanistic aspects of the enzymes involved in signal transduction. In addition, drug screening approaches and possibilities to modulate the disease-related signal transduction pathways using drug molecules will be addressed.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgid avalduvad nelja loengu-mooduli koostoimes. Science & Technology õppekava "Bioengineering and Robotics" suuna üliõpilased peaksid kursuse tulemusel saama üldised alusteadmised bioloogiliste signaalisüsteemide toimemehhanismide osas ja oskuse kasutada saadud teadmisi mehhanismide loogikast ja komponentidest sünteetilise bioloogia valdkonnas: uute elussüsteemide disainimisel, aga ka ravimiarenduses ning biomedistiinilises uurimustöös. Kursus pakub detailse ülevaate rakkude signaalisüsteemidest ja mehhanismidest kolmel põhitasandil: 1) signaalirajad, 2) signaaliülekandes osalevate valkude struktuur, 3) signaaliülekandes osalevate ensüümide kineetika ja mehhanism. Samuti vaadeldakse ravimiarendusmeetodeid ja võimalusi , kuidas mõjutada haigustega seotud signaalisüsteeme ravimimolekulidega.

learning_outcomes.en: Module 1: Cell Signaling, provides an overview of main principles and mechanisms signal transduction.  Concepts like information flow, cellular computation, and decision making will be introduced. A systematic overview of main eukaryotic and prokaryotic signaling pathways will be presented.
learning_outcomes.et: Moodul 1: signaalisüsteemid rakkudes. Moodul pakub ülevaate rakusiseste signaaliradade toimimise printsiipidest, peamistest signaaliradade komponentidest ja mehhanismidest. Antakse ka süstemaatiline ülevaade kesksetest eukarüootsetest ja prokarüootsetest signaaliradadest.

learning_outcomes.en: Module 2: Biomolecular Catalysis, will provide a sufficiently detailed overview of the basic enzyme mechanisms and kinetic approaches to study enzymes.
learning_outcomes.et: Moodul 2 annab ülevaate ensüümide mehhanismist ja peamistest kineetilistest meetoditest ensüümide uurimisel.

learning_outcomes.en: Module 3: Structural Biology, will give a basic overview of protein (and DNA) structure. Special lectures are dedicated to contemporary methods for structural analysis of proteins and other biological macromolecule.  Structural modeling methods and software will be introduced and tested in a seminar.
learning_outcomes.et: Moodul 3 käsitleb valkude struktuuri ja struktuuri uurimise meetodeid. Pakub praktilise kogemuse valkude struktuuri modelleerimise alal.

learning_outcomes.en: Module 4: provides and overview of bacterial signaling, protein synthesis and antibiotic mechanisms.
learning_outcomes.et: Moodul 4 vaatleb prokarüootsete rakkude signaaliradu. Samuti tutvustatakse põhjalikumalt valgusünteesi masinavärki ning antibiootikumide toime- ja resistentsuse mehhanisme.

grade_evaluation.et: Homeworks and the final test, attandance

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.recommended_materials:

Module 2: Structure and Mechanism in Protein science, Alan Fersht
Principles of Protein X-Ray Crystallography, 2007 Drenth, Jan
Module 3: The Resolution Revolution: Recent Advances In cryoEM, Methods in Enzymology, Volume 579, R. Crowther.

description.et: Overview of signal transduction. Principles and mechanisms of protein interactions. Signaling enzymes and their allosteric regulation. Role of post-translational modifications in signaling. Subcellular localization of signaling molecules. Small soluble signaling mediators. Information Transfer across the membrane. Regulated protein degradation. Modular architecture and evolution of signaling proteins. How cells make decisions. Methods for studying signaling proteins and networks.

Signaling Networks: Information Flow, Computation, and Decision Making. MAP kinase pathways. The PI3K-PKB/Akt pathway. mTOR signaling. Calcium signaling. The cyclic AMP pathway. Wnt signaling. Hedgehog signaling. Notch signaling. Signaling by the TGFb superfamily. The JAK/STAT pathway. Toll-Like receptor signaling. Immunoreceptor signaling. Signaling by nuclear receptors. The Hippo pathway

Signaling pathways that control cell division and proliferation. Signaling in control of cell growth and metabolism. Signaling networks that regulate cell migration. Signaling pathways in cell polarity. Signaling mechanisms controlling cell fate and embryonic patterning.

Signaling by sensory receptors. Synaptic signaling in learning and memory. Signaling in muscle contraction. Cell signaling and stress responses. Cell death signaling. Subversion of cell signaling by pathogens. Signal transduction in cancer.

Evolutionary and Genetic Origins of Protein Sequences. Protein diversity. Introns, exons, and inteins and exteins. Divergent evolution of families of proteins. Convergent evolution. Evolution of proteins by fusion of gene fragments. Homology, sequence identity, and structural similarity.

3-D structure of proteins. The structural building blocks. Chemical Properties of Polypeptides. Motifs of Protein Structure Domain Structures. Folding and Flexibility. Assembly of proteins from the building blocks. DNA Structures.
Protein crystallography. Principles of X-ray crystallography. Protein preparation, crystallization, X-ray data collection, structure solution, and refinement.

Cryo-EM. Direct Electron Detectors, Specimen Behavior in the Electron Beam, Specimen Preparation for High-Resolution Cryo-EM, Processing of Cryo-EM Movie Data, Processing of Structurally Heterogeneous Cryo-EM Data in RELION.
Predicting Protein Structure. Structural modeling. Practical approach (Chimaera, COOT etc).

Structure of proteins in solution from NMR methods. Interactions between proteins and protein interactions with small molecule ligans, DNA  etc. Drug docking, structural modeling for drug development.

Catalysis. Transition state theory. The Hammond postulate. Chemical basis of the Hammond postulate. Nucleophilic and electrophilic catalysis, acid-base catalysis. Electrostatic catalysis. Metal ion catalysis. Covalent catalysis. The principle of kinetic equivalence.

Enzyme kinetics. Steady state and rapid equilibrium systems. Reversibility: The Haldane equation. Equilibria in solution. Equilibria on the enzyme surface (internal equilibria). Breakdown of the Michaelis-Menten equation. The structure of enzyme-substrate complexes. Methods for examining stable enzyme-substrate complexes. Multisubstrate systems. The random sequential mechanism. The ordered mechanism. The Theorell-Chance mechanism. The ping-pong mechanism. Useful kinetic shortcuts. Calculation of net rate constants. 
Example 1: The serine proteases. Example 2: Lysozyme.

Enzyme regulation. Allosteric regulation. Kinetic models of cooperativity. Receptor kinetics. Flexibility and conformational mobility of proteins. Higher levels of enzyme regulation: multienzyme complexes and signaling hubs.
Prokaryotic cell-to-cell signaling: quorum sensing and autoinducers. Bacterial biofilms. Mechanisms of the release of toxins that attack the host. Two-component regulatory system.
Chemical biology. High throughput screening. From assay development to screening for chemical probes and drug candidates. The pipeline of pharmaceutical industry. How to proceed from hit to lead.
Mechanisms of antibiotics action and resistance.
